lead_paragraph: The White House had requested the meeting as a signal to Vietnam’s Communist government that the United States cares about human rights in the country.

byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris reported from Hanoi, and Jane Perlez from Beijing.
byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and JANE PERLEZ

headline.print_headline: Rights Activists Are Blocked From Meeting With Obama
headline.main: As Obama Presses Vietnam on Rights, Activists Are Barred From Meeting

snippet: The White House had requested the meeting as a signal to Vietnam’s Communist government that the United States cares about human rights in the country.
abstract: Several Vietnamese human rights activists scheduled to meet with Pres Obama during his trip to Hanoi are blocked from doing so, underscoring lingering gulf between nations on rights abuses; activists critical of Obama for lifting arms embargo against Vietnam without securing human rights concessions say situation proves their point.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
